thread.title: 5 things to know Monday: What is the Scarlet Knights' record vs. top 4 foes?
thread.title_full: 5 Rutgers things to know Monday: What is the Scarlet Knights' record vs. top 4 foes? | NJ.com

author: Keith Sargeant | NJ Advance Media for NJ.com
title: 5 things to know Monday: What is the Scarlet Knights' record vs. top 4 foes?
text:
For the 13th time in the program's 146 years and for the first time since 2007, Rutgers will meet a team ranked in the top four of the national polls.
Michigan State , which was ranked No. 4 in The Associated Press Top 25 after improving to 5-0 with a 24-21 setback of Purdue, will look to live up to its billing this Saturday when it travels to face Rutgers (2-2).
Kickoff for the Big Ten clash at High Point Solutions Stadium is set for 8 p.m., and it will be aired on BTN.
PLUS: Rutgers football Week 6 opponent: Michigan State at a glance
It marks Rutgers' first game against a team ranked fourth or better in the AP Top 25 since Oct. 18, 2007, when the Scarlet Knights shocked then-No. 2 USF, 30-27, home.
Rutgers is 2-9-1 all-time versus teams ranked fourth or better in the AP poll, but has won its last two â€” knocking then-No. 3 Louisville, 28-25, in 2006 and USF the following season.
The following is Rutgers' history versus teams ranked in the top 4 in the AP poll:
Sept. 9, 1978: (L) No. 3 Penn State 26, Rutgers 10
Oct. 11, 1980: (L) No. 1 Alabama 17, Rutgers 13
Nov. 7, 1981: (L) No. 1 Pittsburgh 47, Rutgers 3
Sept. 14, 1985: (T) Rutgers 28, No. 3 Florida 28
Nov. 12, 1988: (L) No. 4 West Virginia 35, Rutgers 25
Nov. 13, 1993: (L) No. 3 Miami 31, Rutgers 17
Sept. 8, 2001: (L) No. 1 Miami 61, Rutgers 0
Oct. 19, 2002: (L) No. 3 Virginia Tech 35, Rutgers 14
Nov. 2, 2002: (L) No. 1 Miami 42, Rutgers 17
Oct. 4, 2003: (L) No. 4 Virginia Tech 48, Rutgers 28
Nov. 9, 2006: (W) No. 15 Rutgers 28, No. 3 Louisville
Oct. 18, 2007: (W) Rutgers 30, No. 2 USF 27
( Source: Rutgers Football Media Guide)
